Sentencas: The effect of Mo doping on the crystal structure and thermal, electrical, and electrochemical properties of the SrCo1-xMoxO3-delta (x = 0.05, 0.1) system has been studied.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells

Sentencas: The introduction of Mo as a substitution for Co in SrCoO3-delta leads to a change from a hexagonal to a tetragonal perovskite structure at room temperature.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity is largely enhanced by the introduction of Mo at intermediate temperature due to the stabilization of the 3D-perovskite decreases the total conductivity probably due to partial disruption of the electronic pathway.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells

Sentencas: The use of these materials as cathodes in a solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and as anodes in a solid oxide electrolyzer (SOE) has been evaluated, showing low values of electrode polarization resistances in both configurations over the intermediate temperature range.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells

Sentencas: Interestingly, better performance was obtained under anodic polarization conditions reaching overpotential values as low as 28 mV for a current density of 210 mA.cm(-2) at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells

Sentencas: The good performance of the SrCo1-xMoxO3-delta compounds in both cathodic and anodic: conditions makes this system a promising candidate for reversible oxygen electrodes in cells that could operate as both SOFC and SOE.
Titulo: A New Family of Mo-Doped SrCoO3-δ Perovskites for Application in Reversible Solid State Electrochemical Cells
